text: Joseph Caullé (3 May 1885 - 1 October 1915) was a French middle-distance runner who specialised in the 800 metres. He competed in the men's 800 metres event at the 1912 Summer Olympics. He was killed in action during World War I. ==See also== * List of Olympians killed in World War I ==References== Category:1885 births Category:1915 deaths Category:French male middle-distance runners Category:Sportspeople from Seine-Maritime Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1912 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of France Category:French military personnel killed in World War I
title: Joseph Caullé
